intro: Dichrotrichum brownii, commonly known as the brown trichodia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Poaceae. It is a perennial grass that typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in temperate regions. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, narrow leaves. Its flowers are usually clustered in panicles and are wind-pollinated. Dichrotrichum brownii is often found in meadows, pastures, and along the edges of woodlands.
